attributes.action: End the wearing of masks for covid 19 recovered patients.
attributes.additional_details: People that have had covid 19 cannot catch and pass on the virus so should not be made to wear face coverings. People that have had covid 19 could possibly be suffering long term lung issues that can worsen with wearing a mask.
attributes.background: End the mandatory wearing of face coverings in all settings for people that have tested positive and recovered from covid 19 .

rejection.details:
People with medical reasons for not wearing a face covering are already exempt from doing so. 

There is no current evidence that having contracted COVID-19 confers any immunity from contracting it a second time

https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/covid-19/latest-evidence/immune-responses

Having a lung condition does not make wearing a mask dangerous:

https://www.blf.org.uk/support-for-you/coronavirus/what-should-people-with-a-lung-condition-do-now/face-coverings
